item.description:
Please RSVP! 

MIT Building 51, Room 325 map -> http://whereis.mit.edu/?go=E51

70 Memorial Drive, Cambridge, MA (Entrance at 2 Amherst Street)

(Parking behind the building, or one block West off Amherst Street on Hayward)

It’s About Time!

 Option Premium Decay and Trading Tactics

 

Don Kaufman, Director, Trader Group, TD Ameritrade

 

Looking to put time decay and volatility to work in your options trading strategy?  Let TD Ameritrade’s, Don Kaufman, walk you through the logic behind constructing trades that may help you meet your goals.  Plus, find out how options, combined with TD Ameritrade’s thinkorswim® technology, can take your trading to the next level.

Please note that this presentation requires some knowledge of options.

Don Kaufman, Director, TD Ameritrade’s Trader Group, is one of the industry's leading option strategists and educational gurus.  In 1999, He started his career at thinkorswim, where he served as Chief Derivatives Instructor helping the firm progress into the industry leader in retail options trading and investor education.  TD Ameritrade acquired thinkorswim in June 2009. Today, he oversees strategy and deployment initiatives as a Director for the Trader Group at TD Ameritrade, which is dedicated to the innovation and education surrounding derivative products.

 

MIT Building 51, Room 315  map ->  http://whereis.mit.edu/?go=E51

70 Memorial Drive, Cambridge, MA (Entrance at 2 Amherst Street)

(Parking behind the building, or one block West off Amherst Street)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 

If you have a friend you talk stocks with, bring them with you! Food or drinks are not allowed in any MIT meeting room. We strongly urge each person to make his or her own decisions about investing their money. Investment ideas and recommendations made during our meetings and in our online dialogs bear no liability by anyone. This is a free and open meeting. No membership is required, but please RSVP.
item.name: Special Speakers Meeting: Don Kaufman from thinkorswim
